Mark Little wrote:
> Second I think we're in agreement concerning not talking about the
> client having to be aware of anything to do with the transaction. The
> act of "start" and "commit" (for want of some terms) is an implicit
> act by the client visiting specific pages/traverses specific links.
> 

In integration scenarios the client is usually the one that is aware 
that something needs to be coordinated. not the server.  In a SOA 
environment these clients are going to be interacting with 
self-contained silos of services that may or may not be aware of a 
transaction protocol, but may be compensatable nevertheless.
